result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Copy of minutes from PLEAS Hrg on 4/25/22 sent electronically to DCJ.

Court reporter Teri Groves.  Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Kathleen Chung.  Lexi Keyes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   By agreement of the parties this case is dismissed but read in.

 On Motion of the State, the Court DRI Count 1 and 2.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
DE was not writ here from from Dodge Correctional. Court to reset hearing.

Plea/sentencing hearing on April 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Kathleen Chung.  Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
Arraignment on February 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Arraignment on February 14, 2022 at 11:30 am.

IN CUSTODY

01:48 PM Defendant Timothy G Garza by video with attorney Kathleen Chung who is appearing specially.  Prosecuting Atty Colleen Lennon appeared for State of Wisconsin. State calls law enforcement, duly sworn. Direct by the State.  Witness id'd De.  Cross examination by Atty Chung.  State moves for bindover, reserves for rebuttal. Defense objecting without argument.  CT finds PC to bind over. Arraignment to be held in trial branch once Atty Chung is appointed. Bail cont.
PSA Report

Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

03:46 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Diana Maria Van Rybroek.  Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
